questions.question: I was taken .............................. by her impertinence.
questions.description: When you are taken aback, you are shocked.

questions.question: The child does not take ............................ either of his parents.
questions.description: To take after somebody is to resemble them in looks or behavior.

questions.question: If you have ten candies and take ............................... six, you are left with four.
questions.description: To take something away is to remove it or subtract it.

questions.question: The fact that the athlete had used performance enhancing drugs, took .............................. his achievements.
questions.description: To take away from something is to make it seem less valuable.

questions.question: I took the shelves ................................... to clean them properly.
questions.description: To take something apart is to disassemble them.

questions.question: A public outcry forced the minister to take ................................ his offensive comments.
questions.description: To take something back is to say that you didn't really mean what you had said.

questions.question: Please take .................................... my address and phone number.
questions.description: Take down can mean write down.

questions.question: Don't take him ............................. an idiot.
questions.description: To take somebody for an idiot is to regard them as an idiot.

questions.question: I took .............................. a pup last month and now he is my best buddy.
questions.description: To take in somebody is to give them shelter.

questions.question: I took .............................. every word they uttered. It was such a mesmerizing performance.
questions.description: To take in something is to absorb it or understand it.

questions.question: Although the airplane took .................................... 30 minutes late, it arrived on time.
questions.description: When an airplane takes off, it begins to fly.

questions.question: I am too busy to take .............................. any extra work.
questions.description: To take on a job is to accept it.

questions.question: Please take your shoes .......................... before entering the temple.
questions.description: To take a piece of clothing off is to remove it.

questions.question: Raj has taken ......................... scuba diving.
questions.description: To take up something is to start a new hobby or activity.

questions.question: Selena takes ............................. her grandmother.
questions.description: To take after somebody is to resemble them.

questions.question: The minister was forced to take his offensive remarks .........................
questions.description: To take something back is to withdraw a statement.

questions.question: This blouse is too loose for you. You must take it .........................
questions.description: To take a garment in is to make it tighter.

questions.question: As our business expands, we will take more people .............................
questions.description: To take somebody on is to employ them.

questions.question: I don’t think I can take ........................... this responsibility.
questions.description: To take on a task is to undertake it.

questions.question: You might have had a bad day at work but you can’t take it .............................. on me.
questions.description: To take it out on somebody is to relieve your frustration by treating them badly.

questions.question: After his father died, he took ............................ their family business.
questions.description: To take over something is to assume responsibility for it.

questions.question: The girl took ........................... her foster parents almost instantly.
questions.description: To take to somebody is to like them.

questions.question: As soon as we saw the leopard, we took ......................... our heels.
questions.description: To take to one’s heels is to run to escape danger.

questions.question: He took ............................ farming after retirement.
questions.description: To take up something is to undertake it.
